question: What is the name of the district where you currently reside or where your observations are being recorded?
description: Please provide the specific administrative district name to facilitate topographical and regional analysis of environmental policy effectiveness.

question: What is the name of your Ward or Gram Panchayat?
description: Please provide the official name of your local administrative unit to facilitate granular analysis of how regional topography and local governance influence the success of environmental mandates.

question: Please specify whether your current place of residence is classified as an urban or rural area.
description: This information is used to analyze how topographical differences and regional infrastructure influence the effectiveness of renewable energy and waste management policies across different demographic settings.

question: Please enter the unique identification number assigned to your household for this survey.
description: This unique ID is used for data tracking and ensures that each response is correctly mapped to the scientifically selected sample for monitoring and evaluation purposes.

question: Please enter your current age in years.
description: Used to categorize responses into demographic cohorts to analyze how different age groups perceive the socio-economic impact of environmental policies.

question: What is your gender?
description: Please specify your gender to assist in analyzing the socio-economic impacts of environmental policies across different demographic groups.

question: What is the average total monthly consumption expenditure of your household?
description: Please provide the total amount spent by your household on all goods and services in a typical month. This information is used to assess the socio-economic impact of environmental policies on different expenditure groups.

question: On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your level of awareness regarding the current national plastic ban policy?
description: This score measures the respondent's self-reported knowledge and understanding of government regulations on single-use plastics to assess the reach of policy communication strategies.

question: On a scale of 1 to 10, how frequently do you use single-use plastic items (such as bags, bottles, or food packaging) in a typical week?
description: This metric is used to evaluate the effectiveness of the national plastic ban by quantifying current consumption habits. A score of 1 indicates no usage, while 10 indicates high-frequency daily usage.

question: On average, what is your monthly expenditure on biodegradable alternatives (such as paper bags, compostable containers, or bamboo products) in Indian Rupees (INR)?
description: This data point is used to assess the socio-economic impact of the national plastic ban by quantifying the shift in consumer spending towards eco-friendly substitutes.

question: What is the main source of energy used in your household for daily needs such as cooking, heating, and lighting?
description: This information identifies whether households are utilizing renewable sources or traditional fuels, assisting in the evaluation of national energy policy effectiveness across different topographical regions.

question: What is the total installed capacity of the rooftop solar system at this location, measured in kilowatts (kW)?
description: Please enter the numerical value of the solar energy capacity currently installed. This data will be used to assess the effectiveness of national renewable energy mandates and analyze how regional topographical features influence solar infrastructure adoption.

question: Please specify the total amount of subsidy (in INR) you have availed under the PM-KUSUM scheme for the installation of solar pumps.
description: This field collects the specific monetary benefit received by the participant, serving as a key indicator for the socio-economic assessment of central renewable energy mandates and the fiscal effectiveness of subsidy distribution within the PM-KUSUM framework.

question: On a scale of 1 to 10, how effective do you perceive the current national environmental policies, such as the plastic ban and renewable energy initiatives, to be in achieving their ecological and socio-economic objectives?
description: This rating serves as a critical Monitoring & Evaluation metric to gauge public perception of policy success, accounting for the socio-economic impact and regional effectiveness of national environmental mandates.

question: Please record the date and time of this survey submission.
description: This field captures the exact timestamp of the response to facilitate chronological tracking and time-series analysis of the environmental policy assessment.
